Html:
My Fishbowl doesn't show the timestamp in the Facebook notifications...

¿Is this normal?

Thanks!
This discussion has been copied to a work item. Click here to go to the work item and continue the discussion.
It's just not yet implemented.  I opened a bug to add it.
Is it just me, or have the timestamps, which appeared as of the most recent update, stopped working as of about 12 Dec?  Happens to me on any machine from whch I run Fishbowl.
Which timestamps?  I haven't added them for notifications yet.  Newsfeed posts should have always had them...

Newsfeed timestamps.  I never had them originally.  After the upgrade to 1.0.1.195 I had timestamps on all newsfeed posts.  But as of 11-Dec I’ve had none again on any new posts in the newsfeed.

Trevor

 

(Sorry I was a bit hasty adding to this thread on notification timestamps)

Weird.  Can you send me a screenshot of your newsfeed?  There should be a gray timestamp at the bottom of the content in the same row as the like and comment buttons.  Nothing's changes since the 11th.

If I can't figure out what's happening from that, would you mind if I send you a version with some extra diagnostics to try to fix this?
Can do.  I'll get it organised later this afternoon (Aus time).  (I know exactly the gray timestamps you mean!)

I think the problem is to do with Australian date order - i.e. dd/mm/yy.  It appears not to display any date where the day is > 12, apparently thinking it is an invalid month.  I have properly displayed dates for all sorts of dates where the day is 1-12, but no displayed dates where the day is >12.  I can see this for entries in November and December.  I only started looking at Fishbowl in November some time.
That makes sense.  It's unfortunately sloppy on my part :(  I'll try to fix this for the next release.
